p: Schmallenberg virus (SBV) is a Simbu serogroup virus in the genus Orthobunyavirus (Family Peribunyaviridae, order Bunyavirales) [ 53]. There are over 170 viruses within the Orthobunyavirus genus including viruses responsible for disease in humans (Oropouche virus, La Crosse virus) and in ruminants (Akabane virus, Aino virus, Cache Valley Fever virus). The Simbu serogroup viruses are prevalent in Africa, Oceania, and the Middle East and include more than 25 viruses such as Oropouche, Simbu, Akabane, Douglas, Sathuperi, Aino, Shamonda and Peaton viruses [ 53]. Akabane virus (AKAV) [ 55, 56], Aino virus (AIV) [ 57, 58] and Shamonda virus (SHAV) [ 59, 60] can cause similar clinical signs and pathology to Schmallenberg virus ( vide infra) [ 26].
